ygData.messageBody:
>I have a question of my own, why is the cleric traditionally a poor class
>(fund wise)? Is it due to the fact that we med so much that we forget to
>loot? I have been hunting with the same group of ppl since lvl 15 and we
>are all pretty fair about loot. However, the other day we took in a dwarf
>paladin, and my gosh, he was a greedy little bastard. Looted everything in
>sight. However, when hunting with my group, I usually get a good
>split...it's the monk who I feel sorry for...he can never carry anything so
>he doesnt loot...but he is the richest one amongst us...=/

The reasons I'm so poor are:

1) I usually med immediately after combat ceases in preparation for the
train the ALWAYS comes when you're down on mana and HPs.... (though
sometimes my group is nice and reminds me to loot)
2) Armour is expensive (still wearing some leather)
3) Spells are even MORE expensive (just hit 20th lvl and I'm still 20PP in
debt to a friend for the last batch of spells...
4) Give over most of what I get to keep our Pally in good armour and so he
has good weaps
5) The Wizzie's spells are a bit of a priority after I buy heals and
buffs...so he can blow the crap out of stuff and save us from having to H2H
it...
6) I'm pretty absentminded, and if not reminded to loot, I forget to =0)
